title: Week 10 Final Exam: Digital Credit & Experience
description: Assessment on modern lending products like BNPL, credit scoring, and the grammar of life experiences using Present Perfect.

questions.question: What does BNPL allow a consumer to do?
options: Pay for everything in cash immediately
Buy an item now and pay for it in future installments
Borrow money from a friend via an app
Invest in the stock market with high risk

questions.question: Which term describes the numerical representation of your creditworthiness?
Complete the experience: 'I __________ never used a BNPL service for my shopping.'
What is 'Instant Approval' in the context of digital loans?
options: Waiting 3 weeks for a bank letter
A fast decision made by an algorithm within seconds
Paying a fee to get a faster response

questions.question: What is the past participle of the verb 'take'?
Which of these is the annual cost of borrowing money, expressed as a percentage?
Complete the question: '__________ you ever applied for a credit limit increase?'
If you 'default' on a loan, what have you done?
options: Failed to make the required payments

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'Sarah __________ already paid four installments of her car loan.'
What is the 'Grace Period' on a credit card?
options: The time when you can spend more than your limit
The time when you don't pay interest on new purchases
The time it takes for a physical card to arrive
The time you spend talking to a bank teller

options: A loan for millions of dollars
A very large mortgage for a mansion
A small, short-term loan often accessed via an app

options: It means you have a lot of friends
It allows you to get lower interest rates and better loan terms
It makes your phone work faster
It hides your balance from the bank

questions.question: In the Present Perfect, which word do we often use in questions about experiences?

options: The minimum you must pay each month
The maximum amount you are allowed to borrow on one account
